channel.title: shelly fleet on Shelly CLI
channel.description: Recent content in shelly fleet on Shelly CLI

item.title: shelly fleet connect
item.description:
shelly fleet connect

Connect to Shelly Cloud hosts

Synopsis

Connect to Shelly Cloud hosts for fleet management.

Requires integrator credentials configured via environment variables or config: SHELLY_INTEGRATOR_TAG - Your integrator tag SHELLY_INTEGRATOR_TOKEN - Your integrator token

By default, connects to all regions (EU and US). Use –host to connect to a specific cloud host.

Examples

Options

Options inherited from parent commands

SEE ALSO

  • shelly fleet - Cloud-based fleet management

item.title: shelly fleet disconnect
item.description:
shelly fleet disconnect

Disconnect from Shelly Cloud hosts

Synopsis

Disconnect from all connected Shelly Cloud hosts.

This command closes any active WebSocket connections to Shelly Cloud hosts. Note: In CLI mode, connections are typically ephemeral per command. This command is useful for explicitly verifying connectivity and cleanup.

Requires integrator credentials configured via environment variables or config: SHELLY_INTEGRATOR_TAG - Your integrator tag SHELLY_INTEGRATOR_TOKEN - Your integrator token

Examples

Options

Options inherited from parent commands

SEE ALSO

  • shelly fleet - Cloud-based fleet management

item.title: shelly fleet health
item.description:
shelly fleet health

Check device health

Synopsis

Check the health status of devices in your fleet.

Reports devices that haven’t been seen recently or have frequent online/offline transitions indicating connectivity issues.

Requires an active fleet connection. Run ‘shelly fleet connect’ first.

Examples

Options

Options inherited from parent commands

SEE ALSO

  • shelly fleet - Cloud-based fleet management

item.title: shelly fleet off
item.description:
shelly fleet off

Turn off devices via cloud

Synopsis

Turn off devices through Shelly Cloud.

Uses cloud WebSocket connections to send commands, allowing control of devices even when not on the same local network.

Requires integrator credentials configured via environment variables or config: SHELLY_INTEGRATOR_TAG - Your integrator tag SHELLY_INTEGRATOR_TOKEN - Your integrator token

Examples

Options

Options inherited from parent commands

SEE ALSO

  • shelly fleet - Cloud-based fleet management

shelly fleet stats

View fleet statistics

Synopsis

Requires an active fleet connection. Run ‘shelly fleet connect’ first.

item.title: shelly fleet status
item.description:
shelly fleet status

View fleet device status

Synopsis

View the status of all devices in your fleet.

Shows online/offline status and last seen time for each device connected through Shelly Cloud.

Requires an active fleet connection. Run ‘shelly fleet connect’ first.

Examples
